text: The 2018–19 Montenegrin Second League was the 13th season since the establishment of the Montenegrin Second League. The season ran from 12 August 2018 to May 2019. That was the first season with 10 participants. ==Format of competition== A total of 10 teams participated in this edition of the Second League. The new members were FK Kom and FK Dečić who was relegated from 2017–18 Montenegrin First League, and winners of Montenegrin Third League playoffs - FK Arsenal Tivat. This was the first season of Second CFL with 10 participants. At the end of the season, worst-placed team on the table would be directly relegated to the Montenegrin Third League. ===Teams=== The following 10 clubs competed in this season. {| class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align:center;" |- !Club !City !data-sort-type="number"|Finishing in 2017–18 !Stadium |- |style="text-align:left;"|||Tivat||1st in Third League - South Image:Arrow-up.png||Stadion u parku (2,000) |- |style="text- align:left;"|||Berane||6th||Gradski stadion (11,000) |- |style="text- align:left;"|||Kotor||4th||Stadion pod Vrmcem (1,000) |- |style="text- align:left;"|||Tuzi||10th in First League Image:Arrow-down.gif||Stadion Tuško Polje (2,000) |- |style="text-align:left;"|||Igalo|| 8th ||Stadion Solila (1,600) |- |style="text-align:left;"|||Bijelo Polje||7th ||Gradski Stadion (4,000) |- |style="text-align:left;"|||Plav|| 9th ||Stadion pod Racinom (5,000) |- |style="text-align:left;"|||Podgorica|| 8th in First League Image:Arrow-down.gif ||Stadion Zlatica (1,200) |- |style="text- align:left;"|||Podgorica||2nd||DG Arena (1,200) |- |style="text- align:left;"|||Ulcinj||5th||Stadion Olympic (1,500) |} == League table == ==References== ==External links== *Football Association of Montenegro - Official Site Category:Montenegrin Second League seasons Montenegro Category:2018–19 in Montenegrin football
